parts: The Global Data Plane is the name of the suite of protocols and languages that make it as easy to publish and query data as it is to publish and read a web page.  The pages which describe the software components are at https://global-data-plane.github.io/sdtp.  Design a web front page for the Global Data Plane project which describes the goals and implementation of the data plane
flattened: The Global Data Plane is the name of the suite of protocols and languages that make it as easy to publish and query data as it is to publish and read a web page.  The pages which describe the software components are at https://global-data-plane.github.io/sdtp.  Design a web front page for the Global Data Plane project which describes the goals and implementation of the data plane

parts: {"prompt":"A modern and visually engaging web front page design for the Global Data Plane project. The design includes a header with the project name and tagline, 'Making data as accessible as web pages.' Below the header, there is a hero section with an abstract graphic representing interconnected data nodes and pipelines. The hero section includes a brief introduction text and a 'Learn More' button. The main body is divided into three sections: 'Goals' featuring icons for accessibility, simplicity, and interoperability; 'Implementation' showcasing diagrams of protocols, languages, and sample workflows; and a 'Get Started' section with quick links to documentation, GitHub, and community resources. The footer has social media links and copyright information. The overall design uses a clean and modern aesthetic with a blue and white color scheme, minimalistic typography, and subtle animations for hover effects.","size":"1792x1024"}
flattened: {"prompt":"A modern and visually engaging web front page design for the Global Data Plane project. The design includes a header with the project name and tagline, 'Making data as accessible as web pages.' The main body is divided into three sections: 'Goals' featuring icons for accessibility, simplicity, and interoperability; 'Implementation' showcasing diagrams of protocols, languages, and sample workflows; and a 'Get Started' section with quick links to documentation, GitHub, and community resources. The footer has social media links and copyright information. The overall design uses a clean and modern aesthetic with a blue and white color scheme, minimalistic typography, and subtle animations for hover effects.","size":"1792x1024"}
